item.description:
Learn about and experience The Hidden Treasures of Korean Art and Modern Korea on October 14, 2012 from 1 – 4 p.m. Once known as the Land of Morning Calm, Korea now possesses the 10th to 12th largest economy in the world. Two documentary films about Korea will be shown, presenting the artistic, spiritual and cultural of Korea's past and Korea's industrial achievements since the Korean War.  Also, a traditional wedding ceremony will be performed. Complimentary samples of Korean food, and a book and craft sale will be available.

Presented by Korean Spirit and Culture Promotion Project and sponsored by the Buddhist Faith Fellowship. Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies, 343 Washington Terrace, Middletown. Free of Charge. To register, visit our Hidden Treasures of Korea Registration webpage.
item.how_to_find_us: Plenty of free parking on both sides of the street.

group.name: Buddhist Faith Fellowship in Middletown, Ct

item.name: The Hidden Treasures of Korean Art and Modern Korea
